description:
“I have no interest in real girls!”

So claims Okumura, the president of the school’s manga club. He’s your typical otaku, obsessed with a sexy (fictional) 2D manga character known as Lilliel. Then the new school year starts, and a (real!) 3D girl named Lilysa whose passion is cosplay joins the club. Lilysa convinces Okumura to become her photographer–and guess who her favorite manga character is? Not only that, but Lilysa is into modeling the fetishy stuff! The boundaries between 2D and 3D start to blur as this hot-blooded romantic comedy unfolds.

(Source: Seven Seas Entertainment)
synonyms: 2.5 มิติ ริริสะ

tags.name: Cosplay
tags.description: Features dressing up as a different character or profession.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: School Club
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a school club scene.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Photography
tags.description: Centers around the use of cameras to capture photos.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Gyaru
tags.description: Prominently features a female character who has a distinct American-emulated fashion style, such as tanned skin, bleached hair, and excessive makeup. Also known as gal.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tomos12)

He started working at Studio Deen, where he made his debut as animator in an episode of Dai Guard. After leaving Deen he became freelance and works mainly on productions for J.C.Staff but also on some titles for Bones, Gonzo and Feel. He is particularly renowned as bishoujo animator, since he tends to pay attention to detailed character appearance and traits for girls, as well as providing his characters cute and bashful gestures.

Currently freelance he resides in Tokyo. Yoshioka is a member of the Writers' Guild of Japan and the Television and Radio Writers' Association of Japan.

[Website](http://www.takawo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/takawoy) | [Twitter 2](https://twitter.com/takawoyy)

[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/linnjardim/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/linnjardim) | [Facebook](https://facebook.com/linnjardim) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@linnjardim5427)

Linn Barros Dutra Jardim, better known as Linn Jardim, is a Brazilian actress, voice actress, dubbing director, and translator. She is the daughter of voice actors [Marcus Jardym](https://anilist.co/staff/191886/) and Bia Barros.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
~!- Mari McCabe / Vixen (2015-Present; Official voice in DC Animations)
- Kara Zor-L / Karen Starr / Power Girl (Superman & Batman - Public Enemies)
- CJ Parker (Baywatch)
- Gabriella "Gabby" Penrose-Howe (The Outlaws)
- Molly Beth Gordon (Reacher)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/chikara923vn)

Affiliated with [J.C. Staff](https://anilist.co/studio/7/), where he is one of the studio's leading animators.
Ryoutarou Akao is the founder and representative director of Studio Gao.
